Pre-Game Insights: Two teams headed in opposite directions will clash on Sunday, when the Charlotte Hornets visit Rocket Mortgage Fieldhouse to take on the Cleveland Cavaliers.
The Hornets (7-26) are looking to snap a nine-game losing streak and own the second worst overall record in the Eastern Conference.
The Cleveland Cavaliers have reeled off nine straight victories and own the best overall record in the NBA.
Cleveland F Isaac Okoro has been sidelined for the last two weeks with a sprained AC joint in his right shoulder.
The Cavaliers have covered an NBA best 25 of their first 34 games and are clicking on all cylinders.
Take Cleveland to win and cover at home against Charlotte’s 29th ranked offensive unit.
